page.title: 13BRITAINS RAILWAYS
page.content: Britains Railways are now getting old. So in 1982 British Rail launched a Â£40 millon modernisation plan. This included rebuilding stations and new trains.Most of todays railways are now mainly electrified, except Branch lines which still use Diesel Multiple Units.British Rail owns over 7,100,000 miles of track over Britain and Ireland.The line which runs through Hockley is served by the more economical Electric Multiple Units. The newer models have sliding doors which open and close at the touch of a button.Signalling is mainly Multiple Aspect Signals.Old semaphores are still used but only on Branch Lines and Steam museums.Todays Railways are criticized for not being on time.But like the Beeching Report in 1960 British Rail are still losing money and closing Railways.
